Recap: Harley is packing her things to leave the police force for Spaulding Enterprises and asks Mallet to keep an eye out on Gus. She is surprised by a going-away party from "the guys". Gus plans to take Zach and Jude to Zach's first T-Ball game. It is very apparent Gus is limping and in pain. He keeps muttering to himself that he can do this, referring to giving up drugs cold turkey and runs into Marina at Company. He tells her he has an interview with a nurse at Cedars but needs to take the boys to the game and Marina offers to help. Gus goes to Cedars and attempts to get a doctor to give him a prescription for pain medicine. The doctor tells him he will have to check Gus's medical records from Rick before he can do that. Suddenly, the doctor is called away to a "code blue" and Gus eyes the blank prescription pads in view. Harley tries to find Gus at Company only to be told by Ava that he had an interview. Harley shows up at Cedars in time to find Gus just after he has stolen the prescription pad.

After Tammy and Jonathan make love, she remembers to tell him what she suspects about Lizzie. She tells Jonathan that after hearing Lizzie thank Rick for the pregnancy information, she thinks Lizzie is pregnant. She even thinks that there could be a possibility the baby isn't Coops. Jonathan looks shocked. After finally getting the courage to go into Company, Lizzie drags Coop to her apartment filled with new baby items and tells him the news; she is pregnant with his baby. Lizzie tells him that she plans on keeping this baby and he needs to decide what he's going to do. After extensive questioning of Lizzie, a confused Coop finally goes back to Company to face Ava. Jonathan suddenly shows up at Lizzie's apartment and asks, "Hey, Goldilocks. Do you have something you want to tell me?"
Transcript: Gus: Stop it, stop it, stop it, stop it. May not need to medicate yourself.
Harley: Slow down.
Gus: Hey! Look who it is, it's a whole mess of kids. How is everyone?
Harley: We are very excited about t-ball tryouts today.
Gus: I know, I know, it's an exciting day.
Zach: Mommy, is your desk next to Gus' desk?
Harley: Actually, this was my desk and that was Gus' desk, but now it's all Gus' desk because I'm working at Spaulding again, remember?
Zach: Can I show Jude the jail part?
Frank: The jail part?
Gus: He wants to see the jail part.
Frank: Yeah, well you know what, Zach, I'll tell you what. We've got too many visitors today.
Zach: You mean the perps?
Gus: Yes, we mean the perps! Yes. We're like a cop family, that's how cop families talk.
Frank: I tell you what. We can do that another day. But today, how would you guys like to see uncle Frank's office, huh?
Gus: No, no, they don't want to do that. How would you guys like to draw some mustaches on some mug shots! ( Laughter )
Harley: Don't encourage that.
Frank: Yeah, don't encourage that. Yeah, guys, come here, we'll have fun, we'll find something to do.
Gus: The guys are ugly anyway.
Harley: You okay?
Gus: Fine. I'm hungry. The pain is manageable, so I don't feel like I need any pills. So don't worry.
Harley: Good. That's really good.
Gus: Um, you know what. I can help you with the box thing because I really could use some space, if you don't mind.
Harley: You're ready to pack up. You want to lose this too, while you're at it.
Gus: No, no, I've got to keep it right there. I've got to do this.
Harley: I'll go to the maintenance closet and get a box.
Gus: Ah, the maintenance closet. I remember it fondly.
Harley: I'll be right back.
Gus: I can do this. I can do this. I can do this on my own. Because I'm a do- it-yourself kind of guy. Not going to let you guys down.

Ava: Oh, gee, I wonder who that could be.
Lizzie: Not answering. That's great, Coop. I'm glad to see that we could be adults about this. ( Knocking on the door ) Oh, she's totally in his face. I've got to get him alone. ( Knocking ) Hey.

Remy: Yeah, we'll miss you, Harley.
Harley: Oh, thank you.

Mallet: Yeah, sure, anything.
Harley: Just keep an eye on him. Just make sure he is okay.

Coop: Okay, fine, what is it then?
Lizzie: I have to show you something.

Coop: You have to show me something-- in your apartment? What do you have to show me, you have to show me some new lingerie? Did you get a new bathrobe you want to put on and then model in front of me? What is it you possibly have to show me? Lizzie, what is all of this?
Lizzie: It's for our baby, Coop. I'm pregnant.

Ricky Paul Golden and Beth Ehlers "Inside The Light." This is her boy, this is her best friend. She is the best sparring partner I've ever had. No, no, no. I think.. who is Harley's best match? Lizzie: It happened. It's happening.
Coop: Oh, my God.

Lizzie: Maybe. Maybe this could be good for us, I mean, I know we've been having problems, but we did love each other. I know how you must be feeling.
Coop: How can you know? Lizzie, how can you possibly know? I don't even know what I'm thinking.

Marina: Well, then you come after. T-ball doesn't move that fast anyway. I'll just hold down the fort until you can get there.

Marina: Absolutely. Hey, guys, change of plans!

Harley: ( Laughs ) Hey, just so you don't forget, I know you won't, but, you know, Gus has been through a lot since you guys worked together, so...
Mallet: Why, do you think he came back too soon?

Harley: You were supposed to. Did you want it?

Harley: There is no room at the inn. I gave Gus my desk.

Harley: So do I, Frank, but I feel like I should give my husband some privacy. And besides, I'm excited to be working back at Spaulding.
Frank: Who would have thought, right? Harley Cooper trading her uniform in for a power suit.
Harley: You love women in power suits.
Frank: Not true.
Harley: How come you don't talk to me about Olivia?
Frank: Because I need to make sure your files are in order here, that's why. Oh, look at there, you misspelled a word.

Harley: Now that I think about it. Where would you be without me?
Mallet: Where would I be without you? Let me see- without you holding me back-- chief of police.

Frank: You know what? On a day like today, you can have it, brother.
Harley: Frank, help me.
Frank: Okay, done. You can clock out.
Harley: Thank you. Stop.
Mallet: What. What?
Harley: You're about to say something heartfelt and meaningful, I can feel it.
Mallet: It's been great being partners with you again.
Harley: You, too. Hey...
Mallet: Hey, what. Stop, stop, you're going to say something heart-felt, too.
Harley: I am. Um, I don't regret any of it. None of it. You?
Mallet: No. ( Applause ) Yeah!
Harley: No wonder you were acting so weird.
Frank: Marina was supposed to here now with the chicken wings.
Harley: Chicken wings? Thank you.
Mallet: I'll take that Frank, thanks.
Harley: Thank you.
Frank: You're welcome, sis. It's a pleasure.
Harley: Thank you. Hey, I feel better. I'm doing the right thing, right? Gus will be fine, right?

Dr. Tompkins: Is there anything I can do?
Gus: I really wrenched my back. I had to take somebody down yesterday, and they sucker punched me and they twisted me all around, you know. It's kind of hard to do the job effectively.

Ava: Yeah, that's what I heard.
Harley: He was supposed to have the day off. Hmmm? Cedars, huh? Well, maybe I can catch up with him there. Thanks. I'm sorry, are you here alone? Where is Coop?

Lizzie: I want to show you some of the stuff that I got. I know it's a little early but...

Lizzie: Fine. I get it. You don't want the responsibility.
Coop: No, Lizzie, that...
Lizzie: No, you don't. You just want to live your carefree life with your slutty little waitress. That's great. Good for you. I hope you guys are really happy.
Coop: Just stop for one second, okay. Don't...
Lizzie: I don't need you. I'm just going to figure something out.
Coop: What does that mean, huh? Meaning what?
Lizzie: I'm keeping it, if that's what you're implying. This is my baby. Lord knows my family has enough money. I can take care of it. I don't need you.
Coop: All right, slow down for just a minute here, okay. Please, you've just dropped a two-ton bomb on me, and you're expecting me to react right now.
Lizzie: Well, excuse me for expecting you... wanting you to feel happy.
Coop: This is a lot right now.
Lizzie: And you made it perfectly clear how you feel about me. You know what? You've got it. You're officially off the hook. You're done. I am tired. I need to lie down.
Coop: Lizzie, I just need some more time.
Lizzie: Take all of the time you need. I'm not going anywhere. Coop, congratulations.

Lizzie: This is Lizzie, you know what to do. ( Beep )
Jonathan: Hey, it's Jonathan, we have...

Tammy: Maybe I should try Lizzie again. If she really is pregnant, who knows what is going through her mind right now, or even Coop's for that matter.

Tammy: Maybe.
Jonathan: I've got to go.

Jonathan: Yeah, some business with a distributor and... I love you. You know that, right?
Tammy: Of course. Hurry back.
Jonathan: I'll do my best. Lock the door behind you.
Tammy: Uh-huh.
Nurse: Did Dr. Tompkins get you everything you need?
Gus: Oh, yeah. He told me to take 400,000 milligrams of ibuprofen. You know, I'm standing here thinking for leg pain, should I do hot compress or cold or just gnaw the leg off?
Nurse: If it's muscular, just alternate between hot and cold.
